website_summaries.verdict: The best value for those looking for an overall durable boot with great comfort and fit.
pros: Buyers praise this boot for its comfort and fit
The boot itself is lightweight and looks great
cons: Some buyers say that the boot is too narrow or tight
You may wish to buy up a half-size

customer_reviews.title: Best traction hands down. Perfect design on the soles for grip.
customer_reviews.text: These boots have the ABSOLUTE best grip of any boot I've ever owned. On top of that, the price on Amazon was $15 cheaper than the local stores around me. I ran FULL SPEED uphill in the snow and did not slip once - I did this to test the boots. I have a coco fiber mat on the porch to scrub my boots off before walking inside to take them off. When I'm wearing these boots it's infinitely more difficult to scrub my boots. That's the only downside of this boot's design...you will have difficulties trying to loose traction and scrub mud off the soles. Super comfortable, only took two weeks to break in and super grippy.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat'em....
customer_reviews.text: Great boots... Would be perfect if they used metal lace holes instead of sewn on leather... But they appear to be sturdy enough. Just not sure about longevity. My last pair of Vasque boots lasted for over 2 years of tough trail terrain and then I got another 21 years of street wear out of them. These are warm and dry. They look good and have great traction... Been wearing them every day and needed no break in. Can't beat'em and Vasque is the right brand!
customer_reviews.author: Geebs

customer_reviews.title: Sorry, but no...Vasque has strange idea of what constitutes "wide."
customer_reviews.text: Boots were labled as 11 W but were at least a half-inch narrower than my 11W Merrell Moabs. They also don't seem to work well with custom orthotics. Really disappointed; I had high hopes for these boots due to the positive reviews and the nearly all-leather construction. Sorry, Vasque...not only no cigar, but not even close. Guess I'm sticking with Merrell from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: anotheroldguy

customer_reviews.title: Great Light Duty boot.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these (first about 3 years ago and still use them around my house for a working-outside-boot). I walk a lot on concrete/asphalt around a prison and soles eventually wear down. Foot problems mean I need extra support (custom insoles). I used to buy Danner, but as they have more and more of their products made in China the quality has continued to decline. I paid less for these than comparable boot from Danner and they are far superior in quality and comfort, and they last longer. They are not intended for mountaineering, but hiking with light packs, camping, day-hikes, they are great. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: B.A. Bengard

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding - Absolutely the best hiking boot I own - Period!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned an older version of this same Vasque Talis Trek boot. They have now provided me outstanding service for at least ten years. I will now retire my dated pair for work and beach. I have now just purchased a new pair. They look the same, feel the same and fit the same. They are as supportive, comfortable and as light as my older pair. I will now dedicate my new pair of Vasque to daily trekking and trail walking my Dashund "Missy" twenty to thirty miles per week. I am now 72 years young and 'without doubt' fully expect that this new pair will last me a lifetime of comfortable service.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Gilman

customer_reviews.title: I've just started breaking them in...
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased for my spouse. The following comments are his: I've only worn them a couple times so far, but wore them all day without issue. I do find the width narrow for a D-sized shoe, which is fine by me since I have B-width feet. This is the reason I marked them as "somewhat narrow", because I suspect a person with true D-width feet is going to say the are "Too narrow". YMMV
customer_reviews.author: Beth C

customer_reviews.title: Width is not correct on boots I purchased, to narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I returned the boots because they were to narrow. Merchant is attempting to only refund half my money, $74.97. I have filed a dispute with my credit card company. Boots were return in new condition. I had to try them on and walk around in them to check the fit, which did not match advertised size 9.5M.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Duke

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots, except for one small detail....
customer_reviews.text: I had to go up a 1/2 size, but it made for a great fit. I really like these boots, with one exception- which seems trivial, but it's irritating! the top 2 metal lace grips, for whatever reason do not hold the lace ,and when you try to tie up, the laces fall right out of the metal clips. Never happened with any of my Merrell's, so I would recommend buying these from the same company Merrell buys them from, and dump the knuckleheads who youre buying them from now! Just saying. Everything else about the boots is great so far!
customer_reviews.author: Seaweed

customer_reviews.title: Too tight or just right...Ahh..
customer_reviews.text: 12 EE I wear a thin, diabetic, sock and "this" shoe fits perfect for my large frame. I expected these to be too tight and happened to get a nice, comfortable, tight fit. It is understandable folks find them too tight. If you have, even a close, wide foot. get the EE. I am concerned about the durability of a mid-weight boot sole, glued not sewn. We will see. So far, I Love Em!
customer_reviews.author: charles pratt

customer_reviews.title: Light and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Lets get the dislike out of the way first since this category is crazy small; the laces can be a bit ornery while loosening. Period. Like? Everything else. The grip is steady and dependable, their weight makes feathers feel bloated, thry are very waterproof with no inherent swamp foot, the color scheme has actually garnered several complements and damn, they are totally comfy. Now, lets see how long they last.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic boots!
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this is an underrated boot. I have too many pairs of hiking boots from various manufacturers, but these might be my favorite. I have a high arch and slightly wide “normal” width foot. I went up a half size and in wide and the fit is perfect. I love the old school look. They are comfortable, breathe well, and have decent ankle support. The price is fair, too. If I had one “gripe,” I wish it had a rubber toe rand, but I’m nitpicking. I would buy them again in a heartbeat. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Even though I have owned these boots for a year I never wear them. For after very little use, the right boot developed a squeak. I attempted various treatments to rid the boot of this annoyance to no avail. I recognize this is my token experience and is likely not usually the case, however, it does not change my opinion. But, overall compared to Keen's Durand or an Oboz Bridger (boots I also own) -appearance, comfort, utility, etc. it is no where close to those boots. Sure, it is priced lower, yet is saving $40ish given reduced boot effects a value? I doubt I would ever consider a Vasque brand boot again.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: A little narrow but OK
customer_reviews.text: 1 month of wear so far. Shoes are a little narrow but comfortable. We'll see how long they last. I am hoping for 10-12 months. The one dislike is the eyelets. The shoe strings slip out easily while lacing and tying. Once tied they have not come loose. Maybe if the strings were round instead of flat they would not slip out as easy. I have bent them closed a little which has helped but not solved the issue. Otherwise they seem good.
customer_reviews.author: BD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots!
customer_reviews.text: Immediately comfortable! Love these things. I've taken them on several long walks in my local nature area, splashing around and muddying them up a good deal. My feet stayed dry as a bone. Good quality laces. Haven't taken them on any serious hikes yet, but I expect they will perform great. These are my first Vasque hikers and I will definitely be turning to them for my future footwear needs.
customer_reviews.author: Saint Sandwich

customer_reviews.title: Solid and light
customer_reviews.text: These held up very well on the wet West Coast Trail, where hiking through mud and water is common. Plenty of support for a 40-pound pack across rugged terrain. Feet were always dry, the shoes were light enough but also sturdy enough for the trail. They required only a small amount of time to break in - three weekends before the hike did the trick. Good, solid pair of shoes, but light enough to be enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Scott

customer_reviews.title: buy these
customer_reviews.text: wow are these nice boots, truly ultradry my feet were not wet from standing in 2 to 3 inches of water. the water did not go higher than the gusseted tongue. they were semi-stiff when first worn, break in was quick and maintained excellent support after. often after break in boots do not continue to properly support your foot, these do. this is a case where you do actually get what you pay for so dont let the price deter you.
customer_reviews.author: eric w

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots. So far I've worn these in the snow, rain and mud. They fit great and are very comfortable. Only issue I would change is the top two metal lace hooks make it hard to lace up....I had to bend them tighter with pliers.
customer_reviews.author: shaun

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe purchase for me in Decades!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes for an Alaska trip. I was working at a church, climbing scaffolding and painting for 4 days. Then I wore them on an eight-mile, 4,000-foot hike at the exit glacier which is listed as a hard hike. These shoes had great traction. I did not slip unexpectantly at all. I want to wear these boots every day. my feet feel fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Wolkowicz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome looking boots
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Vasque shoes that I got at Bass Pro a couple years ago and wear quite often and they still look new. I got these boots to use as a work shoe because of how comfortable the shoes I have and and these don't disappoint. Hopefully they live up to the durability I am expecting because working is a little harder on shoes. I will edit this post If durability isn't what I expect it will be.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Metz

customer_reviews.title: Good bad and ugly
customer_reviews.text: Problem is lace cleats keep letting go of laces when trying to lace up. And just today the lace eye broke while lacing up. Don’t expect a durable product to do this after a few months Amazon doesn’t warranty any of these items. Save your money!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pdiddy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality boot that fits me well.
customer_reviews.text: With size 15, I have trouble finding a good fit. These fit perfectly. The boot is tall enough to provide a bit of ankle support. Previous boots I owned provided ankle protection only. The boot is well made, and seems to have good water repellent properties. So far, I only know that from cleaning them with a hose after use. This is the best fit for my feet since my first pair of Vasque many years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Curmudgeon

customer_reviews.title: good fit and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is a good fit for my 4E foot. I haven't had a chance to use them on the trail yet but around the farm they are great. so I guess I could say they are an excellent work shoe too. The only thing keeping them from getting five stars in my book is that the laces are about two inches too short for me.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: I received thoroughly used boots
customer_reviews.text: When I received these I opened the box to find that these shoes had been worn. And I don’t mean slightly worn, but it seems like they had been owned by someone for over 6 months. There was dirt/mud still caked in the bottom, I pulled the insoles out and there was significant wear and sock fuzz and dust all over. It only disappointed in this purchase but made me rethink buying any boots from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Scala

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, runs small
customer_reviews.text: Pros: supportive, light, easy lacing and unlacing with the tongue pulling out nicely making easy-ons, and more importantly, easy-offs when you are tired and don't want to fight your boots at the end of the day. Walking feels good, the way the sole hits the ground. Even jogged a few times. Feels like a good-compromising cross between a trail running shoe and a sturdier hiking boot. Decent support, and decent 'runnability' and comfort. Cons: runs small width and lengths. I normally wear 10.5m, but I even got a 11W, and it feels nice and roomy. Very happy with these boots, I hope they are durable.
customer_reviews.author: davidd

customer_reviews.title: Dry inside and grippy tread outside
customer_reviews.text: Bigger guy and these fit great. Originally bought them to travel when I was heading to the Pacific Northwest for a hiking trip, now I use them all the time on trails in my area. Never had issues with my feet getting wet even crossing small streams/rivers
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Great medium-duty boot
customer_reviews.text: These boots fit exactly as I expected. They are made very well. I wear them everyday. I am a Utility Forester and need a boot that keeps my feet dry and is comfortable doing a lot of driving in as well. These a perfect medium duty boot. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Sky Twelker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent waterproof boot !! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boot !! Rec’d them on 11/13/18, wore them the very next day to work — spent 9 hrs outside in sleet/rain/snow 28F temps. Feet were dry and comfortable !! I normally wear 12EE work boots, the 13 wide I picked out from amazon fit perfectly. Only drawback was the laces, they constantly popped out of top “hook”, they’re flat style laces. I replaced w 63”long, 3/16 diameter round style and problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: My Honest Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: 3rd pair. I use they for work. Once the treadwear is worn down, I use they for riding quads. Just threw the first pair away after 4.5 years of use. I use softsol inserts along with my custom orthotics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I've held off on submitting this review until I could finally be sure my initial thoughts and impressions were correct. I now have 300 miles of mountain hiking in these boots, in all kinds of weather and on all kinds of surfaces, and think I can say with confidence that these boots are the best I've ever worn. Superb quality, comfortable fit, great traction, durable, light, and all around excellent for outdoor adventure. I don't like to leave one-sided reviews because they don't give a balanced perspective, but I truly have nothing to complain about with these boots. They have been perfect in every respect. I don't think I can wear anything else after this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are great friggin’ boots!
customer_reviews.text: My feet never got wet in two weeks on the Appalachian trail. The come a little snug but eventually stretch out. I’ve worn these boots for two years and still wear them daily (except for summer), and the still look good!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the boot and would not recommend buying this ...
customer_reviews.text: The boot is small in the toe box. I wear a 10.5 2E and it was not wide enough. The boot claimed to be waterproof but my feet were wet when just walking through a dew wet grass trail. Disappointed with the boot and would not recommend buying this premium priced boot.
customer_reviews.author: Keith W. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my boyfriend because he's been wanting new boots. I pulled the trigger after reading the reviews. So happy I did! He LOVES them. They're comfortable and durable. He's only done light hiking in them so far, but he's confident enough to bring them as his sole shoes at an upcoming 3 day festival. He's also taking them on a trip to Peru where we plan to do lots of hiking--will update this review afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: awesome boots lasted for years keep my feet warm
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had Vasque boots for sometime. First pair was while in northern Wisconsin, awesome boots lasted for years keep my feet warm, dry and well ventilated, very heavy duty boots. These Talus boots are similar but as hikers not as heavy duty but build quality better than others. I use these daily and have used them on Grouse hunts. Strong construction, lacing eyelets are ok, could be better if further a part, Well insulated, ventilated, excellent leather quality, stitching as well and the Vibram sole you can not beat. Great purchase , would buy another pair when ready.
customer_reviews.author: Old School

customer_reviews.title: Design changed, feet hurt now!
customer_reviews.text: I have been ordering these for years as work boots and they have worked very well. The last pair I ordered they have revised the design and unfortunately my feet start to hurt within minutes of putting them on. I have wide feet and it feels like the width of the boot has gotten smaller. As much as I really liked these before I’m going to have to try something else!
customer_reviews.author: bikeboy80

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable. Have worn these through feet of snow
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace 25 yr old Vasque hiking boots. Very comfortable. Have worn these through feet of snow, slush, mud and puddles and my feet have been dry all winter! Great boots!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof. Very comfortable and well made.
customer_reviews.text: These were supposed to be waterproof but aren’t . Water will seep through slowly and soak your toes. Very dissapointed in this for what I paid for them. I shouldn’t have to spend more money on waterproofing the leather . I’m keeping them because they fit really welland are very comfortable. I have a hard time finding well fitting boots.
customer_reviews.author: James Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my hubby, who was a lifelong Merrell hiking boot enthusiast. Reluctantly, he admits that he loves them and will be purchasing another pair when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: AShrades

customer_reviews.title: Fits me perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Shoe fit is particularly specific to the individual. I have an average width foot but prefer a little more room in the toe box compared to many other “approach” type hiking shoes. At 1/2 size up from my usual size, Vasque fits me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Philip D.

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Sturdy boots. Needed something for a motorcycle training class, and have wanted to get some hiking boots. The purchase solved both needs and they fit as advertised. I only have about 18 hours on them, but they are comfortable for me, provide sufficient ankle support, and contrary to another review, I haven't experienced the laces coming off the hooks on the ankle area. Could be an issue that will surface with more use, but, so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: David G. Stidham

customer_reviews.title: It looks like it will but will not give you that needed ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a light day-hiking or for short backpack days. I originally bought to see if it'll survive a high-adventure High Sierra trip. It looks like it will but will not give you that needed support if you're packing weight, etc. It's a light shoes as far as its overall weight is concerned. If looking for multi-day boots, check out Vasque Erikson or other similar type mountaineering shoes. But, all-in-all, looks like a well-made shoes suited for particular needs, shorter trips.
customer_reviews.author: ceemig

customer_reviews.title: Nice, But.....
customer_reviews.text: A nice looking boot that runs small.I Normally take a 10.5 D shoe and this boot had no room in the toe area and was a little snug in width,I should have ordered a size 11 . I returned this pair and ordered a size 11, more toe room but still too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: joefish

customer_reviews.title: Vasque wide widths are not wide widths.
customer_reviews.text: The W for wide widths means nothing with Vasque. These are not wide widths. .5 size too long. Narrow depth in the toe box when you try .5 size smaller. Huge loose, sloppy, fit in the heel. Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: These boots have too narrow of a toe box and don't breath well for me. I really like the Teva Arrowood
customer_reviews.author: Shovel

customer_reviews.title: great boot for my shape of foot ( bunions)
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of hiking and backpacking so a good boot is essential to me. Because I have bunions, I need a good quality boot with a wide toe box. Most boots, no matter how well they are made, do not fit me properly. I have been wearing Keens for years because of the toe box issue, as do many people with feet like mine, but Vasque Trek line of boots fit me equally well (although other models of Vasque do not) I recommend Talus boots to others with bunions or a need for a wide toe box in their boot.
customer_reviews.author: John Muir, Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great boots have several pair
customer_reviews.text: These are my main everyday shoes since I have ankle problems. They fit my feet well and are great hiking boots. These hold up well till the soles are worn out. Waterproofing is pretty good but they will start to leak when they stay wet 100% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: perryg114

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend buying them at this price
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit well and were relatively waterproof for the 10 days that I used them in the High Sierra. However, the toe has already begun to peal away from the leather portion. I have other hiking shoes that have done this after years. I would not recommend buying them at this price. If they were cheaper then they would be worth it. However, when you spend over $100 on shoes you expect them to last more than 10 days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok boots.  Seams fail
customer_reviews.text: I have had several pairs of these boots. The last two pairs the seams on the outside failed before the tread was worn out. I had them sized correctly and have not had similar issues with other footwear. I am not re-purchasing and will try other boots. I generally have two pairs of boots and alternate wearing them. I hike about 12 miles a week in addition to everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Best value waterproof boot on the market
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Nice to find a boot made in wide widths. Picked these because of the sole and leather construction. Fit great and very comfortable out of the box. Sole is grippy and has good tread depth. Only gripe, not a fan of the speed lace system.
customer_reviews.author: MikefromLI

customer_reviews.title: Early Review
customer_reviews.text: So I just recently received my boots. Vasque is such a good brand that my initial inspection was brief. They are comfortable and fit as expected. I got these for anticipated snowy Michigan winter. So, will see how this pair holds up. My previous pair lasted several years. It's usually the traction / souls that wear out first
customer_reviews.author: Samuel B.

customer_reviews.title: Super happy with these though
customer_reviews.text: These boots are the BOMB! I went to the Merrell store last weekend and picked up a pair that cost more and didn't fit as well... so I'm taking those back ASAP! Super happy with these though. So far I've only worn them to work (desk job) so I haven't seen how well they perform under more strenuous conditions, but I'm sure they won't disappoint. The toe box leaves just enough room for my toes so that when I hike down I hopefully won't be jamming my toes into the front. They are well padded, but my feet don't get overheated, so there must be some good ventilation even with them being waterproof. Love em.
customer_reviews.author: matt_c

customer_reviews.title: size runs small and narrow
customer_reviews.text: i returned they fit narrower than vasque boots of the past
customer_reviews.author: Fish Slayer

customer_reviews.title: offer good support and traction for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son. He loves them, they fit as expected, offer good support and traction for hiking, while not weighing a ton. This is his second pair of Vasque boots and he's sure they are the best.
customer_reviews.author: boys mom

customer_reviews.title: Great overall boots. Order 1/2 sz up!
customer_reviews.text: Runs narrow, buy at least a half size up. Truly waterproof and very comfortable. Great support on uneven terrain and great traction on the soles that is durable material that seems to resist where while providing a good grippy surface. These are everything I hoped they would be.
customer_reviews.author: JustSomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots
customer_reviews.text: These are the second pair of Vasque boots I have owned. I have a narrow foot and pretty much all other hiking boots fit terrible. These fit my foot fantastic and feel great! I have been wearing them regularly and seriously look forward to backpacking with these on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Wilson Briney Jr

customer_reviews.title: These boot looked great when they arrived
customer_reviews.text: These boot looked great when they arrived. I couldn’t wait to try them on. The boots fit as expected, and were true to size. They are extremely light and comfortable to wear. This is my first pair of Vasque boots and I have not been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: 74captain

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow and too short
customer_reviews.text: Overall a well made boot with good support but the sizing is off. I wear a 10.5 B/C width shoe and these boots are too short and too narrow for my feet. A size 11 might be long enough but then this also changes the location of the arch support section and in my own experience it is not a good solution.
customer_reviews.author: WinterTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot
customer_reviews.text: I love the way these boots fit. I have a B width foot size, and it is very difficult for me to find boots with anything less than a Medium size width. Most Medium sizes are too wide for me and my foot slips within the boot, and finding a B width hiking boot is next to impossible. However, even though these boots are sized as Medium's, they fit my foot very well, no slippage. Thanks Vibaram for making a Great Boot! Patrick
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Day

customer_reviews.title: Good boots should not squeak!
customer_reviews.text: It took a few weeks to break these in - and just as they grew comfortable they developed a squeak. Absolute waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Raine

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: Great boot!! As a landscaper I’m very hard on my boots. These stand up to it all. Good support, keep feet dry, good traction,comfort out of the box and they last!! These will be the only boots i buy from now on. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking/work boots around!
customer_reviews.text: These are quality boots That are warm and very comfortable. The last pair I wore in the Rockies and in Texas and they lasted for 6 years. At $150/pair that works out to be $25/year!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Been buying Vasque shoes since the mid 90’s love them, they have always been reliable hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Been buying Vasque shoes since the mid 90’s love them, they have always been reliable hiking shoes, durable and they last a long time if you take care of them.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Comfortable and Great Traction
customer_reviews.text: After a 1-day break in, I took them on a 10-mile hike (with 1400' elevation gain with 18 lb. pack) without even the slightest blister. I got them "true-to-size" and paired them with Nike Dri-FIT athletic socks. For me, bulky hiking socks sometimes create extra friction that causes the blister. If the boot fits correctly, you shouldn't need thick socks! Anyway, I don't know if these are the best boots on the planet because I haven't tried them all . . . but they're definitely the best I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good boot
customer_reviews.text: Good fit, size 14, comfortable boot. wear it on cement 4 to 8 hours a day at work and is comfortable. I use orthodontics and the boot does well with the inserts. Would buy again, seems that soles wear well.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Martin

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I wore my first pair just about every day for 11 months. They are still very comfortable but no longer waterproof. I didn’t hesitate to order a new pair for my morning dog walks in heavy dew.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory S Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Hubby is a huge Vasque fan and this boot did not disappoint. He wears them daily just doing yard work, walks in the woods, etc. and no backpacking. They are super comfortable with good support. Good looking boot.
customer_reviews.author: idateacher2Top Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: The comfort
customer_reviews.text: I have been in construction for 27 years. For the last few it was hard to find a boot that would last and be comfortable to be on your feet 10 hours a day. When they quit mandating the use of steel toe boots I gave vasque a try. I will not buy a different brand. They are great and last way longer than any other boot I've had. Oh and water proof that's a big plus
customer_reviews.author: Danny Neumann

customer_reviews.title: Not a single thing to complain about so far
customer_reviews.text: Got them today and already put in about 4 miles. Pretty comfy, didn’t feel like they needed to be broken in, and the size is fairly consistent with my Nike running shoes. First pair of hiking boots I’ve bought but I love them so far. Would recommend both the brand and this specific boot.
customer_reviews.author: jeff hassinger

customer_reviews.title: All in One
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable with a multi purpose mid weight boot. Could use on tread mill and elliptical one day, then used for deer hunting the next with plenty of grip on loose terrain. With their good looks could easily be worn for business casual!
customer_reviews.author: Bristolpistol

customer_reviews.title: All good except that the top lace hooks are difficult to ...
customer_reviews.text: All good except that the top lace hooks are difficult to get the lace to stay in as you lace up to tie the boot. Larger diameter laces and larger hooks would work better.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best boot I have ever owned. I walk all day in all kinds of outdoor conditions and these are great.
customer_reviews.author: Rick N.

customer_reviews.title: but so far so good. They were comfortable from the very first day ...
customer_reviews.text: I may rate these boots higher after wearing them more, but so far so good. They were comfortable from the very first day and provide excellent support. Wish I'd bought these before paying for the Columbia boots that will now be given to someone with a higher pain tolerance than I have.
customer_reviews.author: WashingtonWill

customer_reviews.title: Comfort to the max!
customer_reviews.text: Guys, these are the best fitting and most comfortable hiking boots I have ever purchased. Right out of the box they were comfortable, arch support feels great to me. I plan on ordering a spare pair before the change the styles!
customer_reviews.author: TechTony

customer_reviews.title: These are very comfortable hiking boots right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable hiking boots right out of the box. There was virtually no break in period. I used these recently to trek up Mt. Kilimanjaro. They are light and very comfortable compared to others I tried. I have a somewhat narrow foot with very low arches (almost flat).
customer_reviews.author: Breview

customer_reviews.title: So far they are great. I usually wear 10
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these about a week. So far they are great. I usually wear 10.5. I ordered these in that size and they fit right. Nice tread and they seem fairly well built. Also, they are quite light. My last were Keen so I am comparing here. I had some problems with them and these were equally priced. I hope they do better over the course of a year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Talus Trek is great. Surprisingly warm
customer_reviews.text: I wore Vasque's for years and had to upgrade after my Vasque Breeze boots finally broke down. The Talus Trek is great. Surprisingly warm, waterproof, and quite comfortable. Good traction too. I wear them nearly everyday to work and love them.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer1614

customer_reviews.title: Unwearable
customer_reviews.text: Right boot has a ridge inside at the ankle that rubbed my ankle bone raw. Makes them unwearable.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Great job Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Product started to fail 90 days of working with them I'm a finish contractor so not to hard on them the rubber started coming loose from the leather Amazon made it right thanks guys
customer_reviews.author: jas

customer_reviews.title: Too small & seller would not honor same price for larger size
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in size of shoe, will have to go with a wide and maybe up a size as well. Not able to order larger pair due to price difference of over $36 !!
customer_reviews.author: Tom F.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I would compare the fit to a tennis shoes. I wear an 11D in most of my shoes and these are no different. They do seem to run a bit narrow though so keep this in mind. Time will tell the durability. Feel comfortable right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit great
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of shoes, it carries on the tradition of having owned previous pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: First pair of Vasque hikers
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable already. They seem very well made. I need a lot of arch support, so I put power step insoles on top of the ones they came with. Very comfortable like that. Nice amount of room in the toe box, even after adding insoles.
customer_reviews.author: GI Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good boots so far
customer_reviews.text: Got them in the mail right before a very wet and rocky trip in West Virginia. Wore them maybe twice for like 4 hours and no blisters while backpacking. Kept my feet warm and dry until water came in over top on a river crossing, and even then I was still warm.
customer_reviews.author: Kellen

customer_reviews.title: poor quality. arrived with lower eyelet ripped on right ...
customer_reviews.text: poor quality. arrived with lower eyelet ripped on right boot. returning for refund and not replacement. after inspection, it is apparent that eyelets are poorly constructed and secured to the rest of the boot.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boot.
customer_reviews.text: 11 Wide boot fits great. Comfortable and form fitting to my foot immediately. Very well made. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots.
customer_reviews.text: Great boots... very comfortable and for the most part dry. Got caught in 6 hour rain pour and they finally soaked. If planning to hike in really wet weather, I suggest gaiters or waterproof rain pants that fit snuggly over the top of the boot.
customer_reviews.author: J more

customer_reviews.title: but I really love these boots
customer_reviews.text: Have only worn for a few days so far, but I really love these boots. The fit perfectly, requiring no break-in, look great, give me great traction on snow and ice, keep my feet warm, and look really nice! Haven't yet tested them for waterproofness...
customer_reviews.author: michael lerner

customer_reviews.title: Like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I own the low top “Talus Trek” and knew this model was a perfect fit to my foot. This High Top talus fit the exact same in 10.5. Have not hiked in them yet but they feel amazing and knowing they are vasque I’m sure they will hold up for at least 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Peter V

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but narrow
customer_reviews.text: I liked the boots, but had to return them as they do run narrow. I wear a 10.5 D in just about every shoe I own; I saw some of the reviews that these run narrow in the toe box so I ordered 11 D's. While they were plenty long, they were too narrow in the toe area. However, they did feel great and solidly made.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bridges

customer_reviews.title: ***BEST SHOES EVER. USE THEM FOR WORK EVERY DAY*** ...
customer_reviews.text: ***BEST SHOES EVER. USE THEM FOR WORK EVERY DAY*** PLANNING ON BUYING ANOTHER PAIR. WISH THEY CAME IN GRAY COLOR.
customer_reviews.author: honestchristian

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Fit good. Good for day hikes. Probably not enough support for me if im carrying pack over 25 pounds. Laces aren’t the best but overall good boots.
customer_reviews.author: MJE

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and warm.
customer_reviews.text: Bought my pair of Vasque boots in 1973. Have never had a problem yet.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Hamblen

customer_reviews.title: vasque
customer_reviews.text: These looked nice, but were WAYYY too small. back they went.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L. Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Quality boot
customer_reviews.text: Son took them on his 4 week Boy Scout camping trip. He loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Virg

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Just got them yesterday. wore them all day went for big hike with my dogs Feel great
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a two week road/hiking/camping trip in Iceland. The boots are awesome. Never got wet even during rain waterfall splashes ect... very contable. I used every single day during my trip. No complaints. Oh wait! Excellent grip on wet. Definitely buy vasque again!
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable the entire time
customer_reviews.text: First real outing with these were hiking in South Africa: rock, sand, gravel, pavement, forest. Very comfortable the entire time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: My foot has grown 1/2 a size and I had to replace my Vasque hiking boots. I ordered these and have been greatly pleased with their performance. I use these for hiking, backpacking, and just walking around town if I am going to be on my feet all day. Excellent boot.
customer_reviews.author: Skip2thebike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: These Vasque Hiking Boots ARE Awesome, great for trails/the field and they feel and fit great for everyday wear as well. I highly recommend, I wear a size 14US and the fit is perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Boooooooom. Is. Life and love!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This boots have a great sole, the fit its ok. Good material. For trekking it's ok.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Esteban Cataño B.

customer_reviews.title: These boots are the best hiking boots i've come across
customer_reviews.text: These boots are the best hiking boots i've come across. What a great purchase. Kind of wish I purchased through REI though
customer_reviews.author: Jay Lang

product_meta.title: Vasque Men's Talus Trek Ultradry Hiking Boot
product_meta.description:
The vasque talus trek ultradry hiking boot is your go to boot when it's time for an adventure. The 1.8mm nubuck leather and abrasion-resistant mesh shaves weight, while the ultradry liner doesn't leave you exposed to the elements. A softer, more athletic midsole offers excellent comfort, while the vibram nuasi sole grabs hold of the ground.

At Vasque, they are committed to making functional, innovative and aesthetic footwear that performs to the highest standards. Their ultimate goal is to make shoes that inspire you to get outdoors and embark on an adventure. Incorporating and developing new and innovative technologies into their boots is what keeps Vasque at the top of their game.
feature_bullets: Waterproof hiking boot featuring thick cushioned collar and secure lace-up closure with speed-lace hardware at top
